program_description_part1: Using reserve funding from specific, covered USDA Rural Development programs, Strategic Economic and Community Development (SECD) supports eligible projects in implementing strategic community investment plans. Created by local stakeholders, these plans help build rural prosperity by amplifying a community's unique strengths.
program_description_part2: We also can help you identify additional resources, organize and convene potential partners, and leverage other federal, state, local and private funding.
supporting_program_3_name: Water and Waste Disposal Loan and Grant Program
supporting_program_4_name: Water and Waste Disposal Loan Guarantees
eligibility_criteria_1: Be eligible for a covered USDA Rural Development program
eligibility_criteria_2: Be carried out in a rural area
eligibility_criteria_3: Support a multijurisdictional and multisectoral strategic community investment plan
application_requirement_1: Meet all program requirements for the associated SECD-covered USDA Rural Development program
application_form_2_name: OneRD Guarantee Loan Initiative application (if applying through a covered USDA RD loan guarantee program)
project_must_also_2: Identifies strategic partners' monetary and nonmonetary investments, including private and philanthropic organizations and non-USDA funding sources
project_must_also_3: Presents a rural vision and articulates clear objectives, including implementation action steps and measurable performance metrics
application_consideration_2: Shows evidence of collaboration among multiple stakeholders
getting_started_step_1: Each participating USDA RD-covered programs has different deadlines for application receipt. Be sure follow program guidelines carefully.
getting_started_step_2: Contact your state-based USDA Rural Development office for a plan review before submitting your application.
questions_contact_1: Your state-based USDA Rural Development office can answer SECD-covered program questions.
governing_authority: Section 6401 of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 (PL 115-334)
note_information_changes_advice: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_usda_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
